contentrichtext.text: {{Multiple issues|refimprove=October 2009|{{Notability|Music|date=October 2009}}}} {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Trigger | Type = ep | Artist = [[In Flames]] | Cover = In Flames - Trigger.jpg | Released = 10 June 2003 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Melodic death metal]], [[alternative metal]] | Length = 17:26 | Label = [[Nuclear Blast]] | Producer = Daniel Bergstrand, In Flames | Last album = ''[[Reroute to Remain]]''<br/>(2002) | This album = '''''Trigger'''''<br/>(2003) | Next album = ''[[Soundtrack to Your Escape]]''<br/>(2004) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = ''[[Exclaim!]]'' |rev1score = (mixed)<ref>{{cite journal|last=Taylor|first=Laura|date=July 2003|title=Trigger review|journal=Exclaim!|url=http://exclaim.ca/musicreviews/generalreview.aspx?csid1=49&csid2=846&fid1=13971|accessdate=January 16, 2010}}</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Trigger''''' is an [[Extended play|EP]] and song by the [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[melodic death metal]] band [[In Flames]]. The EP was released in 2003 from their 2002 album, ''[[Reroute to Remain]]''. The title song was used on the [[Freddy vs. Jason (soundtrack)|''Freddy vs. Jason'' soundtrack]]. ==EP track listing== {{Tracklist | title1 = Trigger (Edit) | length1 = 4:04 | title2 = Watch Them Feed | length2 = 3:12 | title3 = [[Land of Confusion]] | note3 = [[Genesis (band)|Genesis]] cover | length3 = 3:22 | title4 = Cloud Connected (Club Connected Remix) | length4 = 4:11 | title5 = Moonshield (C64 Karaoke version) | length5 = 2:36 |total_length = 17:26 }} {{Tracklist | headline = Enhanced CD | title1 = Trigger | note1 = Music video | title2 = Cloud Connected | note2 = Music video }} ==Video== The [[music video]] for "Trigger" showed In Flames playing in a club and being constantly pestered and booed by the members of [[Soilwork]], with interspersed footage of other incidents between the two bands. Soilwork's video for "Rejection Role" showed the situation ''vice versa'', Soilwork playing and In Flames as the bullies. The colour is also reversed in each video: blue for In Flames, red for Soilwork. Both videos also had the other band riding in a pickup truck to and from the club. While some believed the tension between the two bands to be real, in reality the groups are close friends and devised the idea of a dual-video concept as a joke. ==Personnel== *[[Anders Fridén]] – [[Singing|vocals]] *[[Björn Gelotte]] – [[guitar]] *[[Jesper Strömblad]] – [[guitar]] *[[Peter Iwers]] – [[bass guitar]] *[[Daniel Svensson]] – [[Drum kit|drums]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{In Flames}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Trigger (Ep)}} [[Category:2003 EPs]] [[Category:In Flames albums]] [[Category:Nuclear Blast Records EPs]]
